queries.description: A non-virtual member function that is hidden defeats polymorphism and causes unnecessary errors and/or complex behavior.
queries.name: Non-virtual public or protected member functions shall not be redefined in derived classes

A10-2-1.title: Non-virtual public or protected member functions shall not be redefined in derived classes.

queries.description: Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one of the three specifiers: (1) virtual, (2) override, (3) final.
queries.name: Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one specifier

A10-3-1.title: Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one of the three specifiers: (1) virtual, (2) override, (3) final.

queries.description: Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with either the override or final specifier.
queries.name: Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier

A10-3-2.title: Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier.

queries.description: Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class.
queries.name: Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class

A10-3-3.title: Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class.

queries.description: Destructor of a base class shall be public virtual or public override to ensure that destructors for derived types are invoked when the derived types are destroyed through a pointer or reference to its base class.  If destruction through a base class pointer or reference is prohibited, the destructor of the base class should be protected.
queries.name: Destructor of a base class shall be public virtual, public override or protected non-virtual

A12-4-1.title: Destructor of a base class shall be public virtual, public override or protected non-virtual.

queries.description: If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final.  If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final to prevent it from being used as a base class.  A base class with a public non-virtual destructor will not invoke the destructors of derived classes when these derived classes are destroyed through a pointer or reference to the base class.
queries.name: If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final

A12-4-2.title: If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final.

queries.description: A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual.
queries.name: A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if itself is pure virtual

M10-3-3.title: A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual.

queries.description: Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments.
queries.name: Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall have the same default arguments or no default arguments

M8-3-1.title: Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments.
